FILE: cm451475v11.0.txt
DYAD: SIERRA LEONE - NIGERIA
RIVALRY: RIV1076
DISPUTE(S): MID4251 

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20190216
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20190216

MID4251 

TERRMID: MID4251 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4251 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4251 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4251 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4251 1 -- civil war MID 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4251 from cm narrative, Nigeria intervened on behalf of Sierra Leone's ousted government (removed from power on 5/25/97 by rebel forces), occupying and fighting in Sierra Leone for almost one year. The dispute ends after Nigeria successfully removes the rebel government and restores power to the ousted regime. Nigeria operated under the auspices of ECOWAS; but, with the exception of minimal support from Ghana and Guinea, Nigeria was basically operating unilaterally. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to a civil war in Sierra Leone, within this dyad. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4251 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4251 cm narrative, Gibler 2018, and news coverage of this event do not suggest that fighting took place outside of Sierra Leone. 

COUPMID: MID4251 1 -- coup MID
COUPMID-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: MID4251 from Gibler 2018 and New York Times 1/25/1998, the Sierra Leone Civil War was precipitated by a coup in 1992 (executed by military elites). The war against rebel forces and the intervention from other states were connected to states' attempt to depose the regime that subsequently took power via the coup. 

COUPLINK: MID4251 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4251 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4251
rivalry=451475 nationa=NIGERIA nationb=SIERRA LEONE MID4251 19970527-19980310 
 revtype1a=REGIME/GOVERNMENT revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=. fatalpa=. lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=. fatalpb=.
lhostb=USE OF FORCE 
RIVNOTES: 

Nigeria intervenes on behalf of Sierra Leone's ousted government (removed from power on 5/25/97 by rebel forces), occupying and fighting in Sierra Leone for almost one year. The dispute ends after Nigeria successfully removes rebel government and restores power to ousted regime. Nigeria operated under the auspices of ECOWAS; but, with the exception of minimal support from Ghana and Guinea, Nigeria was basically operating unilaterally. First day of dispute was on 5/27/1997 and last day of dispute was on 3/10/1998.

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
